importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the announcement indicates when Netflix officially revealed the upcoming series, signaling the start of public interest and media coverage around the new Kennedy family drama.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, tracing the early life and rise of the Kennedy family, providing historical context for their eventual influence on American politics.

keyTakeAways: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy' based on Fredrik Logevall’s book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family across generations.
The show begins in the 1930s, focusing on the ascent of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother.
The narrative blends historical drama with personal drama, reflecting on the human struggles behind the Kennedy mythos.
The series is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story' focused on JFK Jr., avoiding confusion with other Kennedy-related content.
The show will run for eight episodes and has not yet been released, with no official release date provided.
The showrunner, Sam Shaw, describes the Kennedy story as a blend of American mythology and a nuanced exploration of personal and historical development.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A family dynasty and the subject of a new Netflix drama series
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is central to the plot, with the series dramatizing their rise, struggles, and legacy in American history.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An actor starring in the new Netflix series as Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His casting as the patriarch adds star power and draws attention to the series, enhancing its visibility among global audiences.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Author of the book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956' that serves as the basis for the series
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His biography provides the foundational historical narrative and depth of character, lending authenticity to the series.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Showrunner of the series who described the narrative and thematic approach
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provides creative direction and insight into the show’s intent to portray the Kennedy family as both mythic and human.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The streaming platform announcing and producing the series
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: As a major global entertainment company, Netflix's involvement signals the series' potential reach and cultural significance.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: 35th U.S. President and a central figure in the Kennedy dynasty
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His legacy and the family's political prominence are key themes in the narrative and historical context.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of John F. Kennedy, who died in a plane crash in 1999
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His tragic death is referenced as part of the Kennedy family’s tragic history, reinforcing the theme of family curse and personal loss.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Producer of a separate upcoming series on JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His project is contrasted with the new Netflix series to clarify distinctions and avoid confusion between different Kennedy-related narratives.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall's biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956,' which stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr. The series begins in the 1930s and chronicles the rise of the Kennedy family, focusing on the personal and political struggles of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their children, including Jack, who battles to escape the shadow of his older brother. The show, described as blending American mythology with intimate human drama, will run for eight episodes and is not to be confused with Ryan Murphy’s upcoming 'American Love Story' centered on JFK Jr. The series offers a nuanced exploration of the Kennedys’ legacy, their triumphs, and tragedies, highlighting how their story reflects broader American values and historical development.
title: Netflix Announces New Kennedy Family Series Starring Michael Fassbender
